column4: does anyone hav ekeyboard and mouse freeze issues with 10.04 on certain computers?
do they freeze with other keyboards?
its not a keyboard hardware issue that i find, although will have to try that... same keyboard works fine on another 10.04 machine,its a newer corei5 that hates it
is the ram healthy?
yeah, runs win7 and 9.10 just fine. even threw in new ram when the old sticks hated me
maybe its a bug  with the new kernel. I would test the ram just in case
runing memtest86 now...
its not a different distro, its just some different apps
don't use it then, you don't have to use Unity...
what you think I actually use 12.04? using 10.04 right now
you can use gnome-panel in Precise, you can also install any of the many desktop / window managers and not get Unity
Kubuntu 12.04 doesn't have Unity, nor does Xubuntu 12.04, nor does Lubuntu 12.04
I use 12.04, no unity here
I suggest you use Xubuntu 12.04 when Lucid is EOL next year in April
Lucid DESKTOP is EOL in April 2013
https://wiki.kubuntu.org/Releases
if you use Gnome apps a lot, XFCE is built using GTK so will mea you install fewer deps
file /path/to/link
packages.ubuntu.com lists the compatible chips to each driver packages,or you can use apt-cache show  to display the same info
or I recommend grub GUI apps cause it makes life much easier than dealing with the complex mess of grub2. i miss ye old menu.lst

just move the entris in /etc/grub.d and it changes the order. You can put memtest at the top if you like. grub 2 is waay easier then old grub as the changes stay each time as the configs set it up how ou want
plus grub2 can boot ISO files :)
add the boot option:  nouveau.blacklist=1
only you see your highlights
